titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James H. Landrum, Judgment
CWG5735

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Boone Circuit Court Sept 13 -- 1858
Comlth vs James H. Landrum } Larceny
deft appeared in dis recog. cause continued and deft with wic Grubbs, Jno. S. Lucas Thos. Landrum & Francis Landrum bail in sum $300 for ap. next term
cause continued until next term of this court

came the atty for comlth and the defts Jno S. Lucas Thos. Landrum & Francis Landrum not having been summoned this cause is continued as to them and the Deft. Wickliffe Grubbs having been duly summoned and failing to answer answer It is adjudged by the court that the commonwealth of Kentucky recover of the defendant Wickliffe Grubbs the sum of $300 the amount for which he undertook as bail for James H. Landrum at the Sept Term 1858 of this court and which was forfeited and that said Grubbs pay the costs herein expended
Judt on forfeited recognizance against Jno. S. Lucas
Execution issued ags Grubbs alone 27 Sept 1859 which was never taken out of the office
The clerk made a memorandum thus,
It was the agreement with the atto for the commlth and deft that no execution was to be issued for three months in this case

on 23 april 1860
ca. sa. issued
agst
Jno. S. Lucas Thos Landrum and Francis Landrum for $300 & costs returned thus.
"The fine in this case respited for 12 months see respite herein The costs in the case and 20 per cent of fine Replevied with Daniel Smith security June 11th 1860

F. M. Combs
DS for S Lucas S. G.C
